heading: 1. These Rules may be cited as the Nurses and Midwives (Fitness to
text_raw:
1. These Rules may be cited as the Nurses and Midwives (Fitness to 

Practise Subcommittee) Rules 2022. 

Commencement
text_norm: 1 rule may cited nurse midwife (fitness practise subcommittee) rule 2022 commencement

title: conferred on it by section 13 of the Nurses and Midwives Act 2011 (No. 41 of
heading: 2. These Rules come into operation on 9th May 2022.
text_raw:
2. These Rules come into operation on 9th May 2022. 

Definitions

title: conferred on it by section 13 of the Nurses and Midwives Act 2011 (No. 41 of
heading: In these Rules—
text_raw:
3. 

In these Rules— 

“Act” means the Nurses and Midwives Act 2011 (No. 41 of 2011). 

Part 2 

Establishment of Fitness to Practise Subcommittees
text_norm: 3 rules-- act mean nurse midwife act 2011 (no 41 2011) part 2 establishment fitness practise subcommittee

title: conferred on it by section 13 of the Nurses and Midwives Act 2011 (No. 41 of
heading: 4. The chairperson of the Fitness to Practise Committee or a member of the
text_raw:
4. The chairperson of the Fitness to Practise Committee or a member of the 
Fitness to Practise Committee who is also a member of the Board may, at any 
time following the referral of a complaint to it by the Preliminary Proceedings 
Committee pursuant to section 61 of the Act, establish a subcommittee of the 
Fitness to Practise Committee, to be known as a Fitness to Practise 
Subcommittee, to perform the functions of the Fitness to Practise Committee in 
respect of that complaint, including to conduct the hearing of the complaint. 

Part 3 

Membership of Fitness to Practise Subcommittees
text_norm: 4 chairperson fitness practise committee member fitness practise committee also member board may time following referral complaint preliminary proceeding committee pursuant section 61 act establish subcommittee fitness practise committee known fitness practise subcommittee perform function fitness practise committee respect complaint including conduct hearing complaint part 3 membership fitness practise subcommittee

title: conferred on it by section 13 of the Nurses and Midwives Act 2011 (No. 41 of
heading: 5. A Fitness to Practise Subcommittee shall have three members, with one
text_raw:
5. A Fitness to Practise Subcommittee shall have three members, with one 

member designated as the Chairperson of that Subcommittee. 

Notice of the making of this Statutory Instrument was published in 
“Iris Oifigiúil” of 20th May, 2022. 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 [236] 3
text_norm: 5 fitness practise subcommittee shall three member one member designated chairperson subcommittee notice making statutory instrument published iris oifigiuil 20th may 2022 236 3

title: conferred on it by section 13 of the Nurses and Midwives Act 2011 (No. 41 of
heading: 6. Each member of a Fitness to Practise Subcommittee shall be a member
text_raw:
6. Each member of a Fitness to Practise Subcommittee shall be a member 
of the Fitness to Practise Committee at the time of the establishment of the 
Subcommittee.
text_norm: 6 member fitness practise subcommittee shall member fitness practise committee time establishment subcommittee

heading: 7. The Chairperson of a Fitness to Practise Subcommittee shall, at the time
text_raw:
7. The Chairperson of a Fitness to Practise Subcommittee shall, at the time 

of establishment of the Subcommittee, be a member of the Board.
text_norm: 7 chairperson fitness practise subcommittee shall time establishment subcommittee member board

title: conferred on it by section 13 of the Nurses and Midwives Act 2011 (No. 41 of
heading: 8. Where the complaint concerns a registered nurse, one member of the
text_raw:
8. Where the complaint concerns a registered nurse, one member of the 
Fitness to Practise Subcommittee established in accordance with Rule 4 shall be 
a registered nurse.
text_norm: 8 complaint concern registered nurse one member fitness practise subcommittee established accordance rule 4 shall registered nurse

title: conferred on it by section 13 of the Nurses and Midwives Act 2011 (No. 41 of
heading: 9. Where the complaint concerns a registered midwife, one member of the
text_raw:
9. Where the complaint concerns a registered midwife, one member of the 
Fitness to Practise Subcommittee established in accordance with Rule 4 shall be 
a registered midwife.
text_norm: 9 complaint concern registered midwife one member fitness practise subcommittee established accordance rule 4 shall registered midwife

title: conferred on it by section 13 of the Nurses and Midwives Act 2011 (No. 41 of
heading: 10. Two members of the Fitness to Practise Subcommittee established in
text_raw:
10. Two members of the Fitness to Practise Subcommittee established in 
accordance with Rule 4 shall be persons who are not and never have been 
registered nurses or registered midwives in the State or nurses or midwives in 
other jurisdictions. 

Functions and Procedures of Fitness to Practise Subcommittees 

Part 4
text_norm: 10 two member fitness practise subcommittee established accordance rule 4 shall person never registered nurse registered midwife state nurse midwife jurisdiction function procedure fitness practise subcommittee part 4

title: conferred on it by section 13 of the Nurses and Midwives Act 2011 (No. 41 of
heading: 11. A Fitness to Practise Subcommittee shall comply with any written
text_raw:
11. A Fitness to Practise Subcommittee shall comply with any written 
procedures of the Fitness to Practise Committee but otherwise may regulate its 
own procedures when inquiring into a complaint.
text_norm: 11 fitness practise subcommittee shall comply written procedure fitness practise committee otherwise may regulate procedure inquiring complaint

title: conferred on it by section 13 of the Nurses and Midwives Act 2011 (No. 41 of
heading: 12. A Fitness to Practise Subcommittee established under Rule 4 shall stand
text_raw:
12. A Fitness to Practise Subcommittee established under Rule 4 shall stand 

dissolved upon either: 

(a) 

the completion of an inquiry in accordance with section 65(2) of 
the Act; 

(b) where the Subcommittee reaches a decision in accordance with 

section 66(a) of the Act; or 

(c) 

on submission by the Subcommittee to the Board of a report in 
writing on its findings in accordance with section 67(1) of the Act. 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 4 [236]

GIVEN under my hand, 
 16 May 2022 

STEPHEN DONNELLY, 

 Minister for Health.

title: conferred on it by section 13 of the Nurses and Midwives Act 2011 (No. 41 of
heading: (This note is not part of the Instrument and does not purport to be a legal
text_raw:
EXPLANATORY NOTE 

(This note is not part of the Instrument and does not purport to be a legal 
interpretation). 

These Rules have been drafted pursuant to section 13 (2) (h) of the Nurses and 
Midwives Act 2011 as amended by the Regulated Professions (Health and Social 
Care) (Amendment) Act, 2020. 

These rules provide greater detail with respect to the establishment, membership, 
functions and procedures of subcommittees established by the Nursing and 
Midwifery Board’s Fitness to Practise Committee to inquire into specified 
complaints and otherwise perform the functions of the Fitness to Practise 
Committee in respect of such complaints. 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 6 [236]
